Blocking Investments Financing Chinese Military Companies

Overview: Prohibits U.S. persons from transacting in publicly traded securities of companies determined to be "Communist Chinese military companies." Aims to prevent U.S. capital from financing the Chinese military.

Bottom Line: Universities must review endowment holdings and divest any prohibited securities by November 11, 2021.

Key Impacts on Higher Education:

Endowment Management: Requires divestment from securities of designated Chinese companies

Research Funding: May affect research sponsorship or partnerships with designated entities

International Programs: Could impact collaborations with Chinese universities linked to military

Important Dates:

  • 01/11/2021: Divestment period begins
  • 11/11/2021: Divestment must be completed

Affected Departments:

Investment Office, Research Administration, Global Engagement

Action Plan:

Action Required: Yes - endowments must divest from prohibited holdings and report transactions

Immediate Steps (0-30 days):

  • Review prohibited securities list against holdings
  • Notify external investment managers
  • Develop divestment and reporting plan

Short-term Actions (1-3 months):

  • Execute necessary divestments
  • Update investment policies

Long-term Considerations:

  • Monitor for additional sanctioned entities
  • Review risk exposure to China

Resource Requirements:

Personnel: Additional compliance staff time

Budget: Potential for short-term investment losses

Technology: Enhanced portfolio screening tools

External Expertise: Geopolitical risk advisory services
